content: blueleaf by adrienne krey headband the chunky lace pattern adds some texture to this headband but still keeps your ears toasty warning this is the kind of super wide headband that is almost a hat if you want to make this a little narrower use smaller needles or a thinner yarn this looks just as cute in a worsted weight either way it is a super fast knit and would make a great last minute gift there is no set size on this - i added tips to the pattern to get the right length but it is best knit using your own head as a gauge if in doubt go with a smaller circumference as it will stretch out significantly useful information abbreviations m1l - from the front lift loop yarn needles gauge between stitches with left needle knit yarn and gauge any yarn/gauge will work for this the into back of loop chunkier your yarn the wider your headband will be i used malabrigo chunky m1r - for this pattern from the back you will lift loop between stitches with left needle then purl into front of loop needles this is knit back and forth in row not in the round so you can use straight needles or circular k2tog - knit two stitches together needles whatever you have on hand i used size 10 5 us p2tog - purl two stitches together yarn suggestions p3tog - purl three stitches together i would stay away from novelty yarns or any yarn with texture to it since the lace panel will get lost i think this ssk - slip one stitch slip another stitch knit these 2 stitches together looks best with a smooth springy yarn like malabrigo or lamb s pride bulky or knit picks cadena yo - bring yarn to the front of your needle skills ws -
